info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 7:58AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 AM EST, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches across parts of Henderson County over the past 12 hours. The rain is generally tapering off this morning from the west, but runoff of the recent heavy rainfall continues along streams and creeks. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Valley Hill and Crab Creek. Flooding is most likely along Mud Creek at Erkwood Drive on the south side of Hendersonville, and in a few places immediately upstream and downstream of this point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
